capsules_submitted.utterance: So I was just reading about Minerva McGonagall and it's clear that she's an adult. I mean, the way J.K. Rowling describes her as a Transfiguration professor at Hogwarts is pretty telling. She's definitely not a child, you know?

capsules_submitted.utterance: I think Professor McGonagall is an amazing teacher and mentor. I mean, who else can make Transfiguration look so cool? She's always been a role model for me, especially when it comes to standing up for what's right and fighting against the Dark Arts. I really admire her strength and courage, and I think she's one of the most talented witches of our time.

capsules_submitted.utterance: So Flitwick is indeed a female character. I've always been fascinated by the way J.K. Rowling created such well-rounded and complex characters in her books.
